intro: Plagiobothrys californicus var. fulvescens, commonly known as the California false flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are alternate and often have a hairy texture, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. This species is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
